intro: Landtia kilimanjarica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro lily, is a striking flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tanzania. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in shades of yellow and orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
